title: Hunted and Harried
author: Ballantyne, R. M. (Robert Michael)
snippet: "Ha! this is your doing, Glendinning," exclaimed Wallace, who recognisedhis old comrade.

title: Hunted and Harried
author: Ballantyne, R. M. (Robert Michael)
snippet: It was that of his old comrade inarms, Glendinning.

title: Hunted and Harried
author: Ballantyne, R. M. (Robert Michael)
snippet: "Methinks this is our quarry, Glendinning," said Claverhouse, drawingrein as they approached a small cottage, near to which a man was seen atwork with a spade.

title: Hunted and Harried
author: Ballantyne, R. M. (Robert Michael)
snippet: With a fierce roar of mingled horror, surprise, and rage, he sprang intothe room, and his huge fist fell on the brow of Glendinning like thehammer of Thor.

title: Hunted and Harried
author: Ballantyne, R. M. (Robert Michael)
snippet: The onlyeffect of the shriek upon Glendinning was to cause him to order anotherturn of the screw.

title: Hunted and Harried
author: Ballantyne, R. M. (Robert Michael)
snippet: Close at his heels the dragoons followed,Glendinning, on a superb horse, in advance of the party.

title: Hunted and Harried
author: Ballantyne, R. M. (Robert Michael)
snippet: The body of soldiers being too small toventure to interrupt the communion on Skeoch Hill, Glendinning had beentold to wait in the neighbourhood and gather information while hisofficer, Captain Houston, went off in search of reinforcements.

title: Hunted and Harried
author: Ballantyne, R. M. (Robert Michael)
snippet: Burning under the insult he had received,Glendinning felt no such compunctions.

title: Hunted and Harried
author: Ballantyne, R. M. (Robert Michael)
snippet: Blazing with astonishment and wrath, Glendinning drew his sword andsprang at his companion, who, already full of indignation at the memoryof what he had been so recently compelled to witness, could ill brookthe indignity thus offered to the defenceless girl.

title: Hunted and Harried
author: Ballantyne, R. M. (Robert Michael)
snippet: Glendinning gazed at his companion in amazement.

title: Hunted and Harried
author: Ballantyne, R. M. (Robert Michael)
snippet: "You will take one man, Glendinning, and proceed along the path to theright," he said; "I will try the left.

title: Hunted and Harried
author: Ballantyne, R. M. (Robert Michael)
snippet: This guide, Glendinning, had become acquainted with Black at a time whenthe latter resided in Lanarkshire, and, as he had just said, wasunacquainted with the region through which they now travelled beyond theriver Cluden.

title: Hunted and Harried
author: Ballantyne, R. M. (Robert Michael)
snippet: "We should be near the river by this time, Glendinning," said the leaderof the party, reining in and addressing the swarthy trooper.

title: The captain of the guard.
author: Grant, James
snippet: Gray, Crichton, and Glendinning, who — now that their first gust of fury was over, would have saved him — sj^eedily ended his life by the infliction of six>and-twenty wounds.

title: Recollections of a Visit to Glasgow with the British Archæological Associations, August 27th to September 5th, 1888. With notes
author: Lambert, George
snippet: A canon ofthe Cathedral, Matthew of Glendoning or Glendinning, waschosen to replace the Cardinal Bishop.
